Section.Catchline: Security interest arising in purchase or delivery of financial asset.

Subsection.Text: A security interest in favor of a securities intermediary attaches to a person’s security entitlement if:

Paragraph.Text: The person buys a financial asset through the securities intermediary in a transaction in which the person is obligated to pay the purchase price to the securities intermediary at the time of the purchase; and
The securities intermediary credits the financial asset to the buyer’s securities account before the buyer pays the securities intermediary.

Subsection.Text: The security interest described in subsection (1) secures the person’s obligation to pay for the financial asset.
A security interest in favor of a person who delivers a certificated security or other financial asset represented by a writing attaches to the security or other financial asset if:

Paragraph.Text: The security or other financial asset:

SubParagraph.Text: In the ordinary course of business is transferred by delivery with any necessary indorsement or assignment; and
Is delivered under an agreement between persons in the business of dealing with such securities or financial assets; and

Paragraph.Text: The agreement calls for delivery against payment.

Subsection.Text: The security interest described in subsection (3) secures the obligation to make payment for the delivery.
